business.headline: India's GDP grows 105% in 10 years, now at $4.3 trillion: IMFIndia's economic growth in the past decade has outpaced several major global economies. While India's GDP increased by 105%, the US and China saw growth of 66% and 44%, respectively.

IndusInd Bank shares rise as lender seeks recruiters to hire top executivesIndusInd Bank stock price: The formal search process to fill the top managerial positions at IndusInd Bank is set to begin in April. Reacting to the report, shares of IndusInd Bank rose as much as 3% in early trade.

India on track to surpass Japan's GDP, could overtake Germany by 2027: IMFIndia's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) has more than doubled in the past decade, rising from $2.1 trillion in 2015 to an estimated $4.3 trillion in 2025.
Sensex, Nifty open flat as investors await clarity on US tariffs; Zomato drops 3%Sensex, Nifty open flat as investors await clarity on US tariffs; Zomato drops 3%

Top stocks to watch today: IREDA, BHEL, ONGC, HCLTech, IRFC, NCC and moreTop stocks to watch on March 26: Sensex and Nifty aim to extend gains as markets track global cues. Key stocks in focus include ONGC, Maruti, HCLTech, and NCC amid corporate developments and investment moves shaping today's session.

Sensex, Nifty opening predictions on March 26: What to expect today?Over the last seven sessions, the Nifty and Sensex have risen 5.7%, turning positive for the year so far. This rally has been supported by foreign capital inflows and expectations of stronger domestic economic growth.

BYD overtakes Tesla in 2024 revenue, becomes World's top EV makerBYD surpassed Tesla in revenue, reporting $107 billion in 2024. The Chinese EV giant leads China's auto market, while Tesla faces declining sales, boycotts, and a falling valuation amid industry challenges.

Wall Street drifts ahead of report on US consumer confidenceWall Street saw marginal gains on Tuesday after making gains a day earlier in hopes of the Trump administration potentially softening its next set of tariffs.
ATM cash withdrawals to get costlier from May 1. Here's whyThe Reserve Bank of India has approved a hike in ATM interchange fees, raising cash withdrawal costs for customers from May 1, 2025.

Government drops import duty on key parts for EV batteries, phonesFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that the government will exempt import duty on 35 items used to make EV batteries and 28 items used in mobile phone manufacturing.

Sensex, Nifty erase gains to close flat amid tariff uncertainty; Zomato down 6%The S&P BSE Sensex closed just 32.81 points above at 78,017.19 after having gained nearly 700 points in the day. Nifty also followed a similar pattern as it ended with just a 10.30 point gain at 23,668.65.

Air India staff to fly economy as airline tackles passenger concerns: ReportThe move is part of Air India's effort to improve its service and customer experience, following criticism over frequent flight delays.

entertainment.headline: Pedro Pascal addresses dating rumours with Jennifer Aniston after viral dinner picActor Pedro Pascal recently broke his silence on dating rumours with Jennifer Aniston. The actor said that they are just friends and went to dinner.

They wiped out 3 years of my life: Director Devashish Makhija on YRF shelving filmFilm director Devashish Makhija, who has directed critically-acclaimed films like Bhonsle and Jorum, revealed that YRF scrapped his animated film after three years of work. He walked away from a three-film deal with the production house.

Thudarum trailer: Mohanlal and Shobana promise an engaging crime dramaIn the Malayalm film 'Thudarum', Mohanlal is trying to get his car back after police confiscated it. That leads to a lot of drama, chaos and an unexpected mystery. Watch the trailer of the film here.

Sonu Nigam denies stone pelting at Delhi college event, jokes about 'Pookie' bandSonu Nigam denied reports of being attacked at DTU, clarifying that only a vape and a Pookie band were thrown. He warned students but continued his performance, even wearing the band on stage.
Shraddha Kapoor's X account hacked? Cryptic post leaves fans worriedActor Shraddha Kapoor's fans believe that her X account is hacked. A cryptic post from her account has left fans worried.

Yogaraj Bhat: The man and the mind behind Yash, Puneeth Rajkumar's cult classicsYogaraj Bhat is a highly acclaimed director who works in the Kannada film industry. Known for making unconventional love stories, Bhat has directed several films that are now pop culture references in Kannada cinema. Also, he was the mind behind Yash and Puneeth Rajkumar's celebrated films.

Priyanka Chopra celebrates 'freedom' after daughter Malti sleeps, shares funny memePriyanka Chopra shared a hilarious meme about enjoying 'freedom' after Malti sleeps. She had earlier reacted to Malti putting herself back to sleep, calling it a 'win'.

Ben Affleck finds it 'embarrassing' to discuss divorce from Jennifer LopezActor Ben Affleck addressed his split from Jennifer Lopez. He dismissed the drama and praised his ex-wife Jennifer Garner in a recent interview.

Sadia Khateeb shares dream Iftar guest list: Akshay Kumar, John Abraham, and SRKBollywood actor Sadia Khateeb shared her dream iftar guest list featuring Akshay Kumar, John Abraham, and Shah Rukh Khan, revealing her reasons for wanting to dine with these superstars.

Mohanlal prays for friend Mammooty at Sabarimala, responds as controversy eruptsActor Mohanlal performed a special pooja at Sabarimala on March 18. This sparked controversy regarding the Hindu-Muslim faith to which Mohanlal responded at a Chennai event.

Sonali Bendre fractures hand after a fall, concerned fans wish her speedy recoveryActor Sonali Bendre was seen at Mumbai airport with a fractured hand but cheerfully interacted with paparazzi. Fans wished her speedy recovery.

Nick Jonas says daughter Malti is unaware of his fame, calls band 'Donut Brothers'Nick Jonas said daughter Malti is unaware of his stardom and just wants to play 'Moana and Maui' with him. He embraced being a 'girl dad' while Kevin Jonas shared how his daughter is realising the popularity of her father.

Sonu Sood's wife sustained multiple bruises, under observation: HospitalActor Sonu Sood's wife, Sonali Sood, was involved in a car accident along with her sister and nephew. According to the hospital statement, she suffered multiple bruises and is currently stable under observation.

Kamal Haasan shocked as his dear friend Bharathiraja grieves loss of son ManojKamal Haasan offered condolences to director Bharathiraja and family after Manoj Bharathiraja's passing. Manoj died of heart attack on March 25. He was 48.

Final Destination Bloodlines trailer: Death is back to claim lives once againThe Final Destination saga will continue with Bloodlines, the trailer of which was released today, March 25. The film will once again bring back Death and his inventive ways of killing people.

Pedro Pascal on a 5-year leap in The Last of Us Season 2: Incredibly comfortingDuring a press conference, Pedro Pascal shared insights on the emotional challenges of returning to The Last of Us for its second season. He discussed his mindset and the evolving relationship with co-star Bella Ramsey.

Kim Sae-ron's ex-boyfriend denies Kim Soo-hyun's involvement in her deathKim Sae-ron's ex-boyfriend has denied Kim Soo-hyun's involvement in her death, alleging abuse in her marriage. The actress's secret marriage and alleged emotional distress are under scrutiny.

Arjun Kapoor remembers mother Mona on 13th death anniversary: Love you, alwaysActor Arjun Kapoor remembers his mother, Mona Shourie Kapoor, on the 13th anniversary of her passing. He shares an emotional tribute, reflecting on her enduring influence and the pain of her absence.

Tamil actor-director Manoj Bharathiraja dies at 48 in ChennaiTamil actor and director Manoj Bharathiraja, son of legendary director Bharathiraja, died of heart attack at his Chetpet residence in Chennai on March 25. He was 48 years old.

general news.headline: Insensitive, inhuman: Supreme Court pauses 'grabbing breasts not rape' orderThe Supreme Court, which took suo moto cognisance of the controversial order by the Allahabad High Court, said the judgment showed lack of sensitivity.

Yogi Adityanath says Hindus not safe among Muslim families, cites BangladeshUttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, in an ANI podcast, said 50 Hindus cannot feel safe among 100 Muslim families and cited the situation in Bangladesh.

EPS met Amit Shah for 15 mins, wanted Annamalai's role reduced in state: SourcesAIADMK general secretary Edappadi K Palaniswami met BJP leader and Union Home Minister Amit Shah privately for 15 minutes to discuss reviving their alliance, sources told India Today.

Ex-ED chief Sanjay Kumar Mishra inducted into PM's Economic Advisory Council as secretaryFirst appointed as the ED chief in 2018, Sanjay Kumar Mishra was given multiple extensions by the Centre while leading the agency, with the Supreme Court later declaring the third  and final extension 'illegal'.

Kerala Chief Secretary shuts down haters with bold remark on dark skin: I dig blackKerala Chief Secretary Sarada Muraleedharan in a Facebook post, slammed a remark comparing her leadership to her husband's that was linked with her skin colour. Through her post, she called out deep-rooted bias against dark skin.

Yogi Adityanath calls Rahul Gandhi 'namuna', says he helps clear path for BJPIn an ANI podcast, Yogi Adityanath accused Rahul Gandhi of undermining India abroad, and alleged Congress's involvement in foreign-funded Lok Sabha election interference.

India on track to surpass Japan's GDP, could overtake Germany by 2027: IMFIndia's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) has more than doubled in the past decade, rising from $2.1 trillion in 2015 to an estimated $4.3 trillion in 2025.

Trump accuses Putin of dragging ceasefire, Ukraine spots Russia's 'manipulation'Donald Trump and Volodymyr Zelenskyy ganged up on Vladimir Putin hours after the White House announced that both Russia and Ukraine have agreed to pause their attacks in the Black Sea.
Oversharing isn't just mindless chatter, it could be silent cry for connectionWe often look down on oversharers, but experts explain that, for some, it may be a silent call for connection.

Hazaribagh on boil as clashes erupt over songs during pre-Ram Navami eventA scuffle and stone pelting occurred between two groups during the Mangla Julus procession, part of the Ram Navami celebrations, in Jharkhand's Hazaribagh.

Trump signs big election order mandating citizenship proof, cites India exampleDonald Trump has signed a sweeping executive order will drastically alter American voter registration processes, imposing stringent measures.

Fan rants about quality of Hindi commentary, Harbhajan Singh respondsIPL 2025: Former spinner Harbhajan Singh took a feedback positively after a fan commented on the deteriorating quality of Hindi commentary during the tournament.

Elon Musk shares video of astronaut Koichi Wakata playing solo baseball in spaceJapanese astronaut Koichi Wakata was seen enjoying a solo game of baseball while floating in microgravity inside the JAXA (Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency) module of the International Space Station (ISS).

Hands tied, mouth taped: Haryana yoga teacher buried alive over suspected affairJagdeep, a yoga teacher at a private university in Rohtak, was kidnapped in December 2024 and buried alive in a pit that was seven feet deep. His body was recovered on March 24.
Shraddha Kapoor's X account hacked? Cryptic post leaves fans worriedActor Shraddha Kapoor's fans believe that her X account is hacked. A cryptic post from her account has left fans worried.

Couple deported after 35 years in California, their 3 US-born daughters in shockA couple who had been living in the US for 35 years, with no criminal history after coming to America and having three US-born children, have been deported to their native Colombia.

Pedro Pascal addresses dating rumours with Jennifer Aniston after viral dinner picActor Pedro Pascal recently broke his silence on dating rumours with Jennifer Aniston. The actor said that they are just friends and went to dinner.

How a biopic gave debate over Aurangzeb's legacy a violent turn in Nagpur'Chhaava', the biopic on Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj's elder son, has exposed the deep fissures in Maharashtra's socio-political landscape

CBI raids Bhupesh Baghel in Chhattisgarh in Mahadev betting app case, he reactsDays after the ED conducted searches, the CBI today raided the residences of Congress General Secretary and former Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel in Raipur and Bhilai in connection with the Mahadev betting app case.

Maruti Suzuki Icons: A nostalgic ride down the memory lane with the 800, Omni, and EsteemMaruti Suzuki's 800, Omni, and Esteem defined India's roads, blending affordability, reliability, and aspiration. These iconic cars carried dreams, families, and milestones, leaving an unforgettable mark on Indian automotive history.

Oscar-winning Palestinian director detained, kicked, punched by Israeli soldiersOscar-winning Palestinian filmmaker Hamdan Ballal was beaten by Israeli settlers and soldiers in the West Bank, detained for over 20 hours, and subjected to harsh treatment, sparking global outrage.

D Gukesh draws from MS Dhoni: Chess, pressure, and the art of staying coolWorld chess champion D Gukesh reflected on how MS Dhoni has influenced his approach to handling pressure. Speaking to Chennai Super Kings from Chepauk, the 18-year-old Grandmaster shared insights on the art of staying composed.

Trump's adviser admits Yemen strikes chat leak, President downplays breachUS National Security Adviser, Michael Waltz, admitted to mistakenly adding journalist Jeffrey Goldberg to a chat regarding Yemen military actions, while Donald Trump downplayed the incident, deflecting the blame to one of his White House staffers.

sports.headline: IPL 2025 Early Impressions: PBKS Out for Blood with Army of All-RoundersIPL 2025: Punjab Kings started their campaign in style with a powerful show with the bat against Gujarat Titans on Tuesday, March 25. Ponting's side showed promise; could they be one of the front-runners to reach the playoff spots?

Falling short by only 11 runs is a positive, but GT should have won: Sai KishoreIPL 2025, GT vs PBKS: In the post-match press conference, Sai Kishore said that the Gujarat Titans should have won their match against Punjab Kings in Ahmedabad on Tuesday given the position they got themselves in during the run-chase.

RR vs KKR Playing XI Prediction, IPL 2025: Will Rajasthan alter their bowling attack?RR vs KKR Playing 11, Rajasthan Royals vs Kolkata Knight Riders Prediction: Rajasthan and Kolkata will lock horns in Match 6 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) in Guwahati. Both teams will be eager to register a win after losing their respective last fixtures.

Rattled Knight Riders, Royals seek redemption in Riyan Parag's denIPL 2025, Rajasthan Royals vs Kolkata Knight Riders Match Preview: Riyan Parag's RR and Ajinkya Rahane's KKR will be looking to get on the board after heavy defeats to SRH and RCB respectively.

'Improved' Shreyas Iyer ready to play all formats: Sourav GangulyIPL 2025: Former Indian captain Sourav Ganguly said that Shreyas Iyer has upped his game enough in the last 12 months to be able to play all three formats for the Indian team.

Priyansh Arya is fearless, and is technically very correct: Shashank SinghIPL 2025: Shashank Singh praised Priyansh Arya for being fearless and having solid technique after he scored 47 runs off 23 balls for the Punjab Kings in their match against Gujarat Titans at the Narendra Modi Stadium.

Shreyas Iyer one of the best captains, used Vyshak at the right time: ShashankIPL 2025: Shashank Singh praised Vijaykumar Vyshak and Shreyas Iyer after the Punjab Kings got off to a splendid start with an 11-run win over Gujarat Titans at the Narendra Modi Stadium.

Rayudu's Bombay quip goes viral after Shreyas Iyer's selfless 97Shreyas Iyer's selfless 97-run knock and bold leadership helped Punjab Kings secure an 11-run victory over Gujarat Titans, marking a strong start to their IPL 2025 campaign under Ricky Ponting's guidance.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
